recipes.name: Burger
recipes.description: A classic juicy beef burger with fresh lettuce, tomato, and cheese.
recipes.author: by Food18
preparation: Season the ground beef with salt and pepper and form into 4 patties.
Preheat grill or pan over medium-high heat and cook patties for 4-5 minutes each side or until desired doneness.
Toast the burger buns lightly on the grill.
Spread mayonnaise on the bottom half of each bun.
Place the cooked patties on the buns, then top each with a slice of cheese, tomato, and lettuce.
Cover with the top half of the buns and serve immediately.

recipes.name: Paneer Butter Masala
recipes.description: Rich and creamy Indian curry made with paneer cubes in buttery tomato sauce.
recipes.author: by Food18
preparation: Heat butter in a pan and sauté ginger-garlic paste until fragrant.
Add tomato puree and cook until oil separates.
Add spices and salt, cook for 2 minutes.
Add paneer cubes and mix well.
Pour in cream, simmer for 5 minutes.
Garnish with coriander leaves and serve hot.

recipes.name: Salad
recipes.description: A fresh mixed greens salad with seasonal vegetables and a light dressing.
recipes.author: by Food18
preparation: Combine mixed greens, cucumber, tomato, and carrots in a bowl.
Whisk olive oil and lemon juice to make dressing.
Pour dressing over salad and toss gently.
Serve fresh.

recipes.name: Chicken Fry
recipes.description: Spicy and crispy fried chicken pieces marinated with special spices.
recipes.author: by Food18
preparation: Marinate chicken with yogurt, spices, and salt for at least 2 hours.
Coat marinated chicken with flour.
Heat oil in a pan and fry chicken until golden and cooked through.
Drain on paper towels and serve hot.

recipes.name: Soup
recipes.description: A warm and comforting vegetable soup perfect for cold days.
recipes.author: by Food18
preparation: Heat olive oil in a pot and sauté onion and garlic.
Add mixed vegetables and cook for 5 minutes.
Pour in vegetable broth and bring to boil.
Simmer for 20 minutes until vegetables are tender.
Season with salt and pepper and serve warm.

recipes.name: French Fries
recipes.description: Golden and crispy french fries, a perfect snack or side dish.
recipes.author: by Food18
preparation: Peel and cut potatoes into thin sticks.
Soak potatoes in cold water for 30 minutes, then drain and pat dry.
Heat oil in a deep fryer and fry potatoes until golden and crispy.
Drain excess oil, season with salt, and serve hot.

recipes.name: Pancake
recipes.description: Fluffy pancakes served with syrup and fresh fruits for a delightful breakfast.
recipes.author: by Food18
ingredients: Maple syrup and fresh fruits for serving
preparation: Mix flour, sugar, baking powder, and baking soda in a bowl.
Whisk milk, egg, and melted butter in another bowl.
Combine wet and dry ingredients until smooth.
Heat a non-stick pan and pour batter to form pancakes.
Cook until bubbles form, then flip and cook other side.
Serve warm with syrup and fruits.

recipes.name: Biriyani
recipes.description: A fragrant and flavorful Indian rice dish cooked with spices, meat, and herbs.
recipes.author: by Food18
preparation: Wash and soak basmati rice for 30 minutes.
Heat oil in a large pan and fry onions until golden brown. Set half aside for garnishing.
Add garlic, ginger, and green chilies to the pan and sauté.
Add chicken pieces and cook until browned.
Mix in yogurt, tomatoes, biriyani masala powder, salt, coriander, and mint leaves. Cook until chicken is tender.
In a separate pot, boil water and cook rice until 70% done. Drain and set aside.
Layer the chicken mixture and rice in a heavy-bottomed pot, starting with chicken at the bottom.
Top with fried onions and cover tightly.
Cook on low heat for 25-30 minutes to allow flavors to meld.
Serve hot with raita or salad.

recipes.name: Masala Dosa
recipes.description: Crispy fermented rice crepes stuffed with spiced potato filling.
recipes.author: by Food18
preparation: Soak rice and urad dal separately for 6-8 hours.
Grind soaked ingredients into a smooth batter and ferment overnight.
Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds. When they splutter, add onions, turmeric, green chilies, and potatoes.
Cook for 5 minutes, season with salt and garnish with coriander.
Heat a non-stick pan, pour batter and spread thinly to form a dosa.
Place the potato filling inside, fold and cook for 2 more minutes.
Serve hot with chutney and sambar.

recipes.name: Chocolate Chip Cookies
recipes.description: Soft and chewy cookies loaded with chocolate chips, perfect for a sweet treat.
recipes.author: by Food18
preparation: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
Mix flour, baking soda, and salt in a bowl.
In another bowl, cream butter and sugars until smooth.
Add egg and mix well.
Gradually add dry ingredients to wet ingredients, then fold in chocolate chips.
Drop spoonfuls onto baking sheet and bake for 10-12 minutes.
Cool on wire rack and enjoy.

recipes.name: Vegetable Stir Fry
recipes.description: Quick and healthy stir-fried mixed vegetables with soy sauce and garlic.
recipes.author: by Food18
preparation: Heat oil in a wok or pan over high heat.
Add garlic and sauté until fragrant.
Add all vegetables and stir fry for 5-7 minutes until tender-crisp.
Pour in soy sauce and toss to coat evenly.
Serve hot with rice or noodles.
